intro: Canscora stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf cuscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with a tubular shape that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies. Canscora stricta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
